private_information: Initial stack top->bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F (A smallest, F largest).
left_agent.goal: Provide an accurate concise report of the left peg's contents and the legal local moves available from this peg.

middle_agent.goal: Provide an accurate concise report of the middle peg's contents and the legal local moves available from this peg.

right_agent.goal: Provide an accurate concise report of the right peg's contents and the legal local moves available from this peg.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the peg reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for the Tower of Hanoi instance with 6 disks that can be solved with the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 6 disks labeled A (smallest) through F (largest).
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: right peg top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F; left peg empty; middle peg empty.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the left peg. Describe the peg contents from top to bottom and list the legal single-disk moves that can be initiated from your peg, given the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the report concise and unambiguous.
report_state.prompt: Agent name: left_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->left_agent->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->left_agent->goal}. Provide the concise state report and legal local moves.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the middle peg. Describe the peg contents from top to bottom and list the legal single-disk moves that can be initiated from your peg, given the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the report concise and unambiguous.
report_state.prompt: Agent name: middle_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->middle_agent->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->middle_agent->goal}. Provide the concise state report and legal local moves.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the right peg. Describe the peg contents from top to bottom and list the legal single-disk moves that can be initiated from your peg, given the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the report concise and unambiguous.
report_state.prompt: Agent name: right_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->right_agent->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->right_agent->goal}. Provide the concise state report and legal local moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning and must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that fully model the 6-disk Tower of Hanoi instance in this environment, targeting the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct if modelling multi-agent actions is necessary. Ensure the produced PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards conventions and is complete enough to be solved by that planner.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator agent that integrates peg reports to build a complete PDDL domain and problem for this task. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Received peg reports: {state_left}, {state_middle}, {state_right}. Your goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Think step by step, reconcile the reports, ensure disk ordering and move constraints are modelled, and produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
